replies.body: Where are the pizza feet?!?!?

Neat design, but I have two criticisms, if I may.

First, it's not a good idea for him to have spikes on the sides of his legs or calves. However small, if he ever has to put his hands near his hips or thighs, or even put his legs together, he's going to hurt himself. Big no-no.

Second could be classified as me being nit-picky, but that's not a good spot for Morde to be holding his mace. Maces need to rely entirely on the force of the owner's swing to do damage, and because of how long the hilt is, a fair amount of the weight is put behind Mordes grasp. This forces his swings to lose power, simply because the weight isn't distributed toward the hitting end. If it was a staff or he was two-handing it, it'd be fine, but neither are the case.

I hope you don't take this the wrong way. It's all unwarranted criticism, and undeserved, but I only say this so your design's in the future can improve. :D

1: he is a suit of armor. There is essentially 0 chance of him hurting himself on those tiny spikes, and he may not even feel actual pain.

2: he is just holding it for dramatic effect. It is obviously designed as a two-handed mace (even though I'm sure he could easily use it in one hand). If he was swinging it, or in a more combat-ready stance, I'm sure he'd be holding it more properly. It's not like a sword where there're pretty much only one way to casually hold it.

Close, he's a suit of armor that USED to go on a human body, if his lore has anything to say about it. Wraith Mordekaiser may not feel pain, but human Mordekaiser did, albeit barely. You have to take the character's backstory into account when making versions of the character, otherwise you'll miss the mark. Even if it's extremely minor, full-body armor that could potentially harm the wearer is just bad design.

As for the rest say what you will, I did say it was me being nit-picky. He does look like he's making an action pose, so he's probably just trying to be intimidating.

I think he needs to look a bit... heavier. The chest plate looks good and the shoulders are nice, but I wish the abdomen and stomach area was a bit wider. It'd give it more of a "hulking suit of armor" look.
I always liked the idea of him having a rather slim abdomen to reinforce the notion that he's just a hollow suit of armour.^^

Not a bad thought, it would make him seem bigger and intimidating, but I like the idea of having his armor tough, yet form-fitting, so his movement isn't restricted so much. It was made in a much earlier time in Runeterra's history, so you could get away with a bulkier and somewhat simplistic design.
With him being just a spirit in a giant suit of armor, and being the embodiment of pain and suffering, I'm pretty sure the more spikes the better lol.

1. Yes, they'd probably get in the way but they do give him a more spiky shilouette, might need to revise the design a tad.

2. I agree, yet this is deliberately so for three reasons:
Firstly it allows me to draw him without the mace obscuring any part of his armor. He'd still be resting the hunk of metal on his shoulder

Secondly; it's more of an action pose to make him seem more intimidating/give him a somewhat broader stance

Lastly but not least; I totally forgot to put more detail into the mace, he'd be grasping it at the bottom and not the middle; artistic fail on my part^^'
